Introduction Last updated: 2019-06-01

Let's know whats Tesla Web and what it can be used for...

it's a web framework inspired by two most popular python web framework, Flask and Django

Django is a high-level Python web framework that encourage rapid development and clean pragmatic design

Flask is a python module that lets you develop web application easily

Tesla web is a middle-level Python web framework, its like this Flask (simple) <--> Tesla web (medium) <--> Django (high)

The amazing part of it is the use of collections of json files as its primary database

manage.py Example:

manage.py is the main entry point of Tesla Web


def main(*args, **kwargs):
    from tesla import TeslaApp
    import core.settings
    import core.urls
    return TeslaApp(*args, **kwargs)

if __name__ == '__main__.py':
    main()

Installation

to install Tesla web make sure you have Python installed

run the command on your terminal: pip install tesla-web

Creating a Project

A project in Tesla web is like the main Application, it consists all the available route and project configuration

Starting a new Project:

open your terminal and go to the location you Want the project to be created and run the following command

tesla startproject
						

	Tesla Admin CLI
	...............

	Enjoy, ;)


project name:|

it will prompt asking you to enter project name

Creating an Application

Application in Tesla web is like a component or python module that define views and urls

Starting a new Project:

open your terminal and go to the location you Want the project to be created and run the following command

tesla startapp
						

	Tesla Admin CLI
	...............

	Enjoy, ;)


application name:|

it will prompt asking you to enter Application name

Starting the development server

Starting a new Project:

open your terminal and go to the location you Want the project to be created and run the following command

running the command without adding the port by default it will be serve on port 8000

tesla serve [PORT]
						

	Tesla Admin CLI
	...............

	Enjoy, ;)


Starting the developing server
INFO:waitress:Serving on http://[::]:8000
INFO:waitress:Serving on http://0.0.0.0:8000

open url address it shows here on your browser

Folder Structure

Project folder structure

here's the best practice for project folder 

[project_name]
 - core
   - settings.py
   - urls.py
   - ... others files follow
 - manage.py

Application folder structure

here's the best practice for application folder 

[app_name]
   - models.py
   - urls.py
   - views.py
   - ... others files follow

Database folder structure

here's how the db will looks like when you open it 

- db
   - User
     - 2e4d5hr5f.json
     - 6r5rfgjg5.json 
     - cfd5e6e57.json
     ...
   - Post
     - se5wdrd4s.json
     - f65re6ed5.json
     ...
   - Groups
     - 56r54fhju.json
     - ghc5dde5j.json
     ...
   ...

Example

in this section we are creating a simple todo application
to start, let's cross our fingers... just joking.

run this on terminal inside the folder we want our project to stay
tesla startproject
I will name mine todo_project

open the project with your best editor, am using notepad ...
let's test our project if it's okay

make sure you open the project folder in your terminal and start the development server
tesla serve

if you saw 404 page not found, congratulations... its up, control-C to cancel the server

now lets create application that will serve our todos
tesla startapp i will name mine app

check your project folder if you saw a folder with the name you provided with some files inside, congratulations

lets connect the two...
this is how i will do mine, Note: app is the name of application i just created

change your project/core/urls.py to above

change your project/core/settings.py to above

lets create our first view

change your project/app/views.py to above

create project/templates/index.html

lets create our Todo model

now lets open our terminal and run the server, if everything is okay you should see this

write something and save... boom, congratulations you have create your first Tesla web application
